title: No Legal Crew Available
text: If no legal crew can be found due to rest or duty violations, escalate to ops center. Contact duty manager for extension approval or alternative crew assignment.

title: Hotel Overflow
text: In case of full hotel capacity, crew must be booked in backup lodging within 50 miles. Notify crew scheduling immediately and authorize additional transportation if needed.

title: Weather Delay Protocol
text: For weather delays, crew duty may be extended by up to 2 hours with manager approval. Monitor continuously for further delays requiring crew replacement.

title: Maintenance Delay
text: If maintenance exceeds 4 hours, crew should be reassigned. Begin spare crew search, passenger communications, and consider alternate aircraft deployment.

title: Crew Repositioning Guidelines
text: When repositioning crew via other flights, ensure minimum connection times are met. Priority boarding and aisle seats should be arranged when possible.

title: Emergency Accommodation Protocol
text: If standard crew hotels are unavailable, authorize premium accommodations up to 150% of normal rate. Document decision and notify finance within 24 hours.

title: Duty Time Extension Rules
text: Flight duty periods may be extended beyond normal limits only for weather or ATC delays. Requires duty manager approval and must not exceed regulatory maximums.

title: Spare Crew Activation
text: Activate spare crew for delays exceeding 2 hours when original crew approaches duty limits. Coordinate with crew scheduling for optimal positioning.

title: Irregular Operations Escalation
text: For system-wide disruptions affecting multiple flights, activate emergency command center and implement IROP procedures. Senior management notification required.
